definition:
Suppose $S \subset {\mathbb{R}}^n$ is an open set (usually connected),
then we define
$$T_S := \{ z \in {\mathbb{C}}^n \mid \operatorname{Re} z \in S \} .$$
We call $T_S$ the [*tube domain*]{} associated to $S$.

Basically the idea is that these domains give you complete freedom in
the imaginary coordinates. An interesting fact about these domains is
that $T_S$ is pseudoconvex if and only if $T_S$ is convex in the
geometric sense, and this is true if and only if $S$ itself is convex.
